reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Marriott. I was there for a convention so didn't leave the hotel much but enjoyed a good Mexican restaurant a couple of blocks away and there were easy walking destinations. The room was comfortable and quiet. The lifts did take a while. The hotel was nice about letting me extend my stay at the last minute.
reviews.title: Enjoyable business convention hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is well placed and the facilities find. But better than either the hotel or its facilities are the staff who cannot do enough for you.
reviews.title: Excellent staff at an excellent hotel

reviews.text: My only concern since my last visit is that the hotel when you book now wants to both take the funds up front (we tend to book for a fair 10 months ahead) and if for any reason you change your mind or your arrangements change they want a hefty cancellation charge.
reviews.title: Business hotel with a fabulous view

reviews.text: Stayed three nights for a large meeting. General condition of the hotel is ok, nothing fancy, and the rooms (at least the one we stayed in) could use a face-lift -- the light in the bathroom was of the horrible fluorescent kind. But bed was comfy ;-) The view of Frankfurt was spectacular and is one of the key pluses of the hotel. Staff friendly and attentive, breakfast in the 'bistro' was nice and relaxing.
reviews.title: nice business hotel, breakfast room a bit overcrowded

reviews.text: The Marriott Frankfurt am Main is a nice business hotel. I spent time there with my family, one baby due to heavy snow fall. The flight was one day delayed. Nice room in the upper floor with a perfect few over down town. The breakfast was ok but this small room was totally overcrowded. We took the dinner in the american diner restaurant. Great burger, I can recommend it ;-)
reviews.title: Poor value for money for a Marriott...Very Disappointing Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed there for two nights having great expectations about this hotel.
reviews.title: dissapointed

reviews.text: when we arrived the doormen did not pay attention at all to us cause they had a small chat so why to bother to help the clients...check-in was unwelcoming.
reviews.title: Typical Older Marriott but do not eat there

reviews.text: the corridors of the hotel had an '80's feeling although everything was brand new.the room we had on the 37nth floor was very well decorated, i can say it was very pretty with great views.
reviews.title: Good hotel but expensive

reviews.text: there was all the amenities for a relaxed stay.there was a troussers press machine but it turned out that from the multiple use it turn out to mess your trousers than to iron them.
reviews.title: Very expensive hotel with porr service

reviews.text: the bed was very comfortable.there was a mini bar empty of goodies-if you wantd they could fiil it but the first impession was bad-this is not what 5 star hotels do -i wanted to have a soft drink after we arrived and i had to order it.why the need of a mini bar for convinience since you have all the time to ask for replacement?
reviews.title: Outdated rooms but excellent location for the messe

reviews.text: 5 minutes from bahnhof, long check in with little sleep (annoying), OK executive lounge, regular marriott room, nice view.
reviews.title: Nothing special with little value

reviews.text: Better choices in Frankfurt available, little value for money.
reviews.title: Good but more on the average side - starting to show it's age

reviews.text: A lot of conference guests, friendly staff.
reviews.title: Fine to earn Marriott points, but not much else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really like the location of the Frankfurt Marriott - close to the West-End and some very nice restaurants. This being the main reason that I chose at this stay after quite some time not being here.
reviews.title: Businessman's Hotel, truly nothing special...
I would be gutted if I had spent my own money
reviews.text: Well I must say that the location did not disappoint and the staff was very friendly and just excellent - really trying to help whenever they can. The rooms though are disappointing and really starting to show their age - not up to Marriott or indeed 4 star hotel standards anymore. So not to be misunderstood, they are very clean with everything in working order and comfortable bedding but apart from that a renovation would not be a bad idea - just not what one would expect these days from a Marriott.

Amazing View of Frankfurt and the staff is extremely professional. You can arrive at the hotel front door form the Tram 16/17. The 40th floor gave a wonderful view of the city. Free Wi-Fi for Platinum and easy access to all the attractions in Frankfurt. Loved he Stadel Museum and Cathedral of St Bartholomew! the Hauptbahnhof is amazing! Sorry, I love the old train stations in Europe. As always in my Marriott stays in Europe - The staff was amazing!
reviews.title: Amazing View of Frankfurt

reviews.text: The Frankfurt Marriott is a nice enough American-style hotel close to the Messe and public transportation to be very convenient for the business traveler. The rooms are a bit smaller than American Marriotts, but they have all the usual amenities. The bed did not seem to be the full Marriott bed, which was disappointing, but it was moderately comfortable. The Executive lounge was very nice with a great breakfast and good snacks. They served dinner too, but I didn't experience it. While the hotel was nice enough, the staff who worked there were excellent! They were happy to map locations for us, assist with recommendations, whatever we needed. When our group got stranded due to an issue with the trains, one desk agent booked us a car, got us an extra night at the hotel and even gave me a complimentary bottle of water. Her attention and assistance turned a bad situation into a manageable one. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice for Business Travel - Great Service!
first rate rooms
reviews.text: recently put here by others arranging my schedule. very american-like hotel. would stay again in a second if on business. very nice breakfast, too. The main restaurant, champions, showed american football; but, I would not eat there again. just barely average. daily internet was almost $30, so be aware.

I stayed here for 2 nights as part of a large group on business. My stay got a bit off to a rocky start when the room that was assigned to me was not clean. Then my key did not work for the replacement room. But the staff bent over backwards to make it right for me, they even sent a fruit basket with a note of apology to my room the next day.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: The rooms are very nice, the executive lounge is wonderful with great views.
reviews.title: Forgettable stay
special
reviews.text: stayed in the executive suite , had a private elevator, plush, soft robe laid out on the bed.
Very spacious ! service excellent !
reviews.title: Excellent old school hotel experience !

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel twice earlier and I look forward to come back to it again and again. Located conveniently across the street from Messe Frankfurt (Fair ground), this hotel offers an excellent package on executive floors (I think floors 40 - 44). Excellent views of the city, special lounge open throughout the day with food, internet, coffee, etc. and b'fast as part of package makes it a good deal. The food is decent too..
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: The hotel had all the features one comes to expect from a big city European business hotel. No problems. Cafe was decent. Breakfast buffet on weekend was 45 Euro. Pricey but worth it considering Frankfurt is not cheap. Gym is quite good. did not use Internet. Located a bit out of way of city center but fairly easy walk to subway. One stop to Rommer and museums, touristy stuff, and wurst.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.text: Weekend rates are actually fairly reasonable.
reviews.title: Helpful Staff and Lovely Executive Lounge

reviews.text: Loved the hotel. Staff was extremely friendly and helped us at every step. The room were spacious and clean. The restaurants were also good. Complete value for money. They have well spread breakfast buffet, though its not very different every day. But all in all we had a very gud stay.
reviews.title: Great hotel, better people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great experience at the Frankfurt, Marriott! The staff is very knowledgeable and extremely friendly!
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: For a 5-star hotel, they really should've fixed up the internet connection in guest rooms. During his one-night stay at the hotel, my husband couldn't check email or browse the web most of the time, as the internect connection in his room was too flaky. He was very disappointed by his stay, considering all the rave reviews on TA. For a business traveller, it just won't do when he can't check emails in his hotel room.
reviews.title: Poor internet connection - not good for business travellers
Good Business Hotel
reviews.text: This is a good business hotel and I got an excellent deal via priceline (85 Eur). Rooms are a bit small, but the view is extraordinary (38th floor). The sportsbar serves thin and crsipy Italian pizza, American burgers, and German beer - perfect!
On the negative side: internet is not for free.
reviews.title: Executive Lounge one of the nicest & review of half day rhine river tour

reviews.text: If your purpose is to be close to the Frankfurt Messe than you can rate the location as excellent. If you intent to visit the old city or do something else then hang out with your collegues I would only rate it average for location. I reckon for this purpose it would be better to book a hotel closer to the city center and then take the metro to the Messe.
reviews.title: Ok when visiting Frankfurt Messe otherwise look elsewhere

reviews.text: The room we had was extremely clean and everything worked as it should although we had to replace the keycards a few times as they stopped working. The interior in the room feels dated: with lovely green carpet early eighties style and a big CRT-tv.
reviews.title: Comfortable room, good service, busy bar

reviews.text: The air in the room was extremely dry. We tried the airco on the coldest position but even then it would give out dry air. The buffet breakfast is average (actually typical buffet quality); for us it was included in the price if I had to pay for it I would feel sad.
reviews.title: Not up to standard. Tired, old hotel, horrid staff
Convenient and clean
reviews.text: The concierge was helpful and we liked the way how they use the minibar: instead of filling the fridge full with overpriced stuff you do not need; they have a small mini-shop in the lobby where you can pick the items you want for a reasonable price.
Not so reasonable priced (but seen unfortunately in more business hotels) are the price of the internet and the parking.
reviews.title: Friendly service in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical Marriott, clean rooms, comfortable bed, large bathroom. The desk receptionist gave us a room on the 20 something floor with a view looking at downtown Frankfurt...a great view, especially at night! I used the fitness center, also very clean with good equipment.
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed here with my husband for free with Marriott points and even though it was "free" (not- 25,000 Marriott points have value), I would not stay here again. Here's why:
reviews.title: Average hotel in an inconvenient location

reviews.text: 1. Location- Unless you are in Frankfurt to visit a trade show at the Messe (which we were not), it is about a 20 minute walk into the center of town. Also, there is nowhere to go in the immediate area other than one other mid-price hotel.
reviews.title: Decent business hotel

reviews.text: 2. Staff- Maybe dire security issues at the Marriott explain why there are dour, unsmiling security guards dressed in ill-fitting black suits with nametags and and ear pieces constantly manning the lobby. At first I thought they were bellman but I learned my lesson when I asked one of them near the Concierge Desk for a city map and he scowled at me. The next morning I asked another one at the Bellman Stand to store my luggage and he was similarly unfriendly. Marriott- These "people" are your representatives. What gives with the mean attitude?
reviews.title: Overpriced for what you get

reviews.text: 3. Hot Rooms- No A/C and no ventilation. Who care if it is Nov.? I would like to have the choice of having cool circulating air while I sleep.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location a bit old-fashioned
